Query 1.title: Favorite Thermal Baths, Hot Springs and Spas Around the World
Query 1.snippet: Luxury Travel Blog. Ideas to inspire your world: luxury, culture, food, travel, style. February 17, 2024. Favorite Hot Springs, Thermal Baths & Spa ...

content.content:
[Content truncated]... (wormwood) in a deep wooden soaking tub. The water is heated with river stones that have been warmed over a fire until glowing red. Placed in a compartment of the tub, they release a high concentration of minerals and can be replenished throughout the soak. Our favorite luxury resorts also have the option for a deep tissue massage and other spa services after the bath.



An incredibly relaxing and rejuvenating cultural experience, soaking in a Bhutanese hot stone bath overlooking spectacular Himalayan landscapes is an ideal way to end a day of touring or hiking to the Tiger’s Nest monastery.
10. Sulfur Bathhouses in Tbilisi, Georgia



The famous sulfur baths and bathhouses in Tbilisi, Georgia, have been part of the Georgian capital’s cultural heritage and architectural landscape for centuries. Dating to the fifth century when, according to legend, King Vakhtang I established Tbilisi after discovering the area’s hot springs, (Tbilisi means “warm” in Old Georgian) the public sulfur baths have played a central role in Georgian society as a place for socializing and conducting business.



Although a bathing culture was prevalent in Tbilisi in the 13th century, the handful of bathhouses that still exist were constructed in the 17th and 18th centuries during Ottoman rule, resulting in design heavily influenced by Persian baths with domed ceilings and mosaic tiles. The most iconic bathhouse in Tbilisi, Chreli Abano (Orbeliani), is distinguished by its colorful mosaic facade inspired by Islamic architecture. 

Clustered around the Abanotubani (“bath district”) neighborhood of the Old Town, the bathhouses are below street level and are discernible by their unusual beehive-like structures that give the area its distinctive look; the brick domes provide the underground bathhouses with light and ventilation.





We can arrange for private VIP rooms for our travelers interested in experiencing Georgian bathing culture, including soaking in the hot, mineral-rich sulfur waters and an exfoliating scrub administered by a bath attendant, followed by a massage.


Other notable sites to experience local bathing cultures include the luxurious spas at our favorite hotels in Switzerland, known for their grand architecture, modern wellness therapies and spectacular settings… 

…the Dead Sea in Israel and Jordan; jjimjilbangs in South Korea, traditional Korean bathhouses that feature saunas lined with Himalayan salt pebbles, jade stones, clay or charcoal; visiting cenote in Mexico; open-air thermal pools in New Zealand and hot baths in the Peruvian jungle.

We also take travelers to see incredible ruins of ancient Roman bathhouses at notable archaeological sites in England, Europe, the Middle East and North Africa.







Contact Artisans of Leisure to begin planning a private luxury tour that incorporates local spa and wellness practices and memorable visits to unique local thermal baths. 


 
Destinations:  Asia, England, Europe, Finland, Georgia, Hungary, Iceland, Italy, Japan, Morocco, Scandinavia, Turkey, UK

Query 1.title: The Art of Wellness: Designing Luxurious Sauna Retreats in ...
Query 1.snippet: Oct 17, 2023 ... A study by the WELL Building Institute reveals how integrating wellness features like luxury saunas can substantially increase property values.

content.content:
A luxury sauna is more than just a wellness amenity; it's an investment in your health and lifestyle.
The appeal of these luxurious havens goes beyond their ability to generate warmth, offering a distinct mix of relaxation, purification, and renewal.
However, navigating the world of luxury saunas can be overwhelming with the numerous options available on the market today. From traditional Finnish designs to modern infrared models, each type brings its own set of benefits and features.
In this comprehensive guide about luxury saunas, we will delve into everything you need to know - from understanding their cultural significance to choosing your perfect fit based on design elements and material quality.
]
Photo by HUUM on Unsplash
The Rise of Wellness Amenities in Modern Architecture
-----------------------------------------------------
Modern architecture is increasingly embracing wellness amenities, responding to a growing trend that prioritizes health and well-being. Luxury saunas are leading this movement, as they offer not only an escape from daily stress but also promote overall health through benefits such as improved circulation and detoxification.
A study by the WELL Building Institute reveals how integrating wellness features like luxury saunas can substantially increase property values. This underscores the dual benefit of incorporating these elements into architectural design - promoting occupants' health while enhancing business profitability.
### Serve Fitness Centers and Spas: Sauna Heaters
Fitness centers or spas equipped with  provide an added layer of opulence, catering to the escalating consumer demand for wellness facilities. These heating systems range from traditional wood-burning stoves to electric models boasting advanced temperature controls, all designed for effective sauna sessions.
### Beyond Heat: Luxury Living Essentials in Modern Spa Design
Incorporating luxury living essentials extends beyond just providing heat; it entails creating a holistic spa experience that fosters relaxation and rejuvenation. Consider steamers, back heaters paired with bath salts, modern spas—a contemporary twist on age-old bathing rituals—or infrared light therapies celebrated for their deep penetrating heat and therapeutic properties.
Navigating Prominent Brands and Customer Reviews
------------------------------------------------
*   Pricing: Luxury doesn't always mean exorbitantly priced items; sometimes it's about finding value where quality meets affordability—this holds true even when considering sauna brands.
*   Maintenance Requirements: This includes understanding what type of care your chosen heater will need over time—is regular cleaning necessary? Will parts need replacing after certain usage?
*   Shipping and Delivery Procedures...[Content truncated]

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This article elaborates on luxury saunas and wellness features in modern architecture, providing insight into the design elements that could be relevant to identifying spa-like settings. It includes the intersection of architecture and health, which aligns with features possibly seen in the video.

Query 1.title: Roman Baths: A Dive into Ancient Luxury Spa
Query 1.snippet: Architectural Marvels: The Design and Construction of Ancient Bathhouses. The sophisticated design of ancient bathhouse architecture stands as a testament to ...

content.content:
[Content truncated]... the magnitude of these communal spaces, one need only look at the archaeological remains of renowned sites such as those in Bath, England. These ruins stand as a testament to the grandeur and significance of the institution throughout classical antiquity.
> The public baths were not just places of hygiene but were intricately woven into the social and cultural fabric of the time—a true reflection of lifestyle and luxury.
Below is a summarized glimpse into the various functions of the Roman baths and how they served as precursors to our modern-day spas:
| Purpose of Roman Baths | Contemporary Spa Equivalent |
| --- | --- |
| Hygiene and Cleansing | Detoxification Therapies |
| Leisure and Relaxation | Wellness and Relaxation Packages |
| Socializing and Networking | Spa Social Lounges |
| Therapeutic Routines | Therapeutic Water Treatments |
| Display of Wealth and Power | Luxury Spa Amenities |
Roman baths functioned within a society that valued not just cleanliness but also the holistic nourishment of body and soul. This philosophy laid the groundwork for the all-encompassing spa experiences that are highly sought after in our time. The heritage of ancient baths—where the air was steeped in essential oils, and the corridors echoed with conversations of literature, politics, and commerce—continues to inspire our quest for serene sanctuaries of well-being.
Architectural Marvels: The Design and Construction of Ancient Bathhouses
------------------------------------------------------------------------
The sophisticated design of **ancient bathhouse architecture** stands as a testament to the innovative spirit of the bygone eras, especially within the Roman Empire. The intricacy of **Roman aqueducts** and **heating methodologies** not only highlights their engineering prowess but also their dedication to creating spaces of relaxation and socialization. Let’s delve into the elements that made these structures timeless treasures in architectural history.
### Advanced Aqueduct Systems
Roman engineers revolutionized the way water was supplied to bathhouses by constructing elaborate aqueducts. These feats of engineering spanned great distances, carrying fresh water from mountain springs or lakes directly into the urban heart. The aqueducts not only supplied water for bathing but also for drinking and irrigation, thus sustaining the bustling life of the city. The enormity and precision of these systems illustrated both the ambition and the technical capabilities of ancient Rome.
!(blob:https://roman-empire.net/f19e56331cf34a059197d5fb5b6082dc)
### Heating Techniques and Hypocausts
Perhaps even more impressive than the aqueducts was the method of heating these grand spaces. The Romans employed hypocaust systems, which constituted an early form of central heating. These systems involved a raised floor,...[Content truncated]

It may provide educational resources and information, but its authority in the realm of current events and fake news is limited. It scores average due to the educational nature of its content but lacks news credibility.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This discusses the architectural marvels of ancient bathhouses, which can provide contextual historical architectural features. While it may not directly address modern luxurious settings, it can be referenced for architectural comparisons.

If you’re looking for luxury interior design, Interiors by Steven G (IBSG) can help. We’re a prominent full-service interior design firm focusing on creating luxurious settings and spaces. Our team can help you find the best furniture, fabrics, décor, lighting, greenery, and accessories. Luxury designs have unique attributes that distinguish them from other interior designs. Here’s an overview of five characteristics that identify luxury designs:
Luxury designs are comfortable, welcoming, and elegant. Comfort is one of the prominent characteristics of luxurious designs. Think of soft rugs, plush duvets, expensive finishes, and amenities for relaxation. You can also find custom-made upholstery, splendid curtains, and automation. The goal is to combine style, comfort, and utility to provide a plush setting. Luxury designs are aesthetic and give the most comfort.
At Interiors by Seven G, we provide rich materials and fabrics to create an inviting interior space for your home or business. We use unique textures and patterns to offer a sleek, uncomplicated feel to the room. Our products are also environmentally friendly and sustainable. Luxury interiors depict consistency in designs. The design flows seamlessly from one section to another to create balance in your home.
At Interiors by Steven G, we know that every person has a unique style they want to bring out. Our interior designs accommodate the owner’s style, including custom materials, colors, and finishes. Luxurious interiors reflect the owner...[Content truncated]

Query 2.title: Prservation Brief 17: Architectural Character: Identifying the Visual ...
Query 2.snippet: Character-defining elements include the overall shape of the building, its materials, craftsmanship, decorative details, interior spaces and features, as well ...

content.content:
# 17 PRESERVATION BRIEFS 
# Architectural Character: Identifying the Visual Aspects of Historic Buildings as an Aid to Preserving Their Character 
## Lee H. Nelson, FAIA 
u.s. Department of the Interior National Park Service Cultural Resources Heritage Preservation Services 
The Secretary of the Interior 's "S tandards for Historic Preservation Projects" embody two important goals: 1) the preservation of historic materials and, 2) the preservation of a building 's distinguishing character. Every old building is unique, with its own identity and its own distinctive character. Character refers to all those visual aspects and physical features that comprise the appearance of every historic building. Character-defining elements include the overall shape of the building, its materials, craftsmanship, decorative details, interior spaces and features, as well as the various aspects of its site and environment. 
The purpose of this Brief is to help the owner or the architect identify those features or elements that give the building its visual character and that should be taken into account in order to preserve them to the max-imum extent possible. 
There are different ways of understanding old buildings. They can be seen as examples of specific building types, which are usually related to a building's function, such as schools, courthouses or churches. Buildings can be studied as examples of using specific materials such as concrete, wood, steel, or limestone. They can also be considered as examples of an historical period, which is often related to a specific ar-chitectural style, such as Gothic Revival farmhouses, one-story bungalows, or Art Deco apartment buildings. 
There are many other facets of an historic building besides its functional type, its materials or construction or style that contribute to its historic qualities or significance. Some of these qualities are feelings con-veyed by the sense of time and place or in buildings associated with events or people. A complete understanding of any property may require documen-tary research about its style, construction, function, its furnishings or...[Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: The National Park Service (NPS) is a reliable government agency that manages national parks and offers factual information about historical sites. While not specifically focused on news or fact-checking, the NPS provides accurate and well-researched content about national parks and cultural heritage.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This evidence discusses 'character-defining elements' of buildings, including interior spaces and features, which are pertinent for identifying the architectural style and specifics of the location seen in the video. By understanding these aspects, one can better judge the likelihood of a given setting being related to Epstein's island or not, thereby aiding in discerning the validity of the claims surrounding the video.

Query 2.title: Can Homes Affect Well-Being? A Scoping Review among Housing ...
Query 2.snippet: Nov 30, 2022 ... Now it is well-known that humans spend over 85% of their time in indoor settings. ... interior environments, their layouts and characteristics ...

content.content:
[Content truncated]... review, conducted on the electronic database Scopus, led to the identification of 366 articles. This, after the screening processes based on the inclusion criteria, led to the final inclusion of 31 papers related specifically to the OECD area. The review allowed the identification of five housing conditions \ that, by influencing the IEQ parameters, had impacts on the mental health outcomes addressed. By synthesizing the contributions of the review, a list of design recommendations has been provided. These will serve as a basis for future researchers, from which to develop measures to reduce inequalities in housing by making them healthier, more resilient, and salutogenic.
**Keywords:** architectural features, housing conditions, indoor environmental quality, mental health, design recommendations
1\. Introduction
----------------
The World Health Organization (WHO) declared the COVID-19 outbreak a public health emergency of international concern on the 30 January 2020 because it has spread to such an extent worldwide, affecting a great number of people \\]. The restricted measures of societal lockdowns, which almost every country put in place, undoubtedly reduced the impact of the pandemic \\]. At the same time, they have been detrimental to the quality of life, both physical and mental. Indeed, throughout the pandemic and related lockdowns, time spent at home increased to a great extent \\].
Prior to the COVID-19 pandemic, the population spent 60% of their time at home \\]. Now it is well-known that humans spend over 85% of their time in indoor settings. In fact, the COVID-19 transformed the daily lives of millions of people \\] during its worst outbreaks. It also left permanent changes in our way of living, working, studying, interacting, etc. \,\].
Furthermore, it is well-established that 55% of the population lives in urban versus rural environments, a trend that has been increased by 30% since 1950 \\]. If urbanization continues this way, as expected, it is estimated that by 2050 around 70% of the population will live in urban environments \\]. In addition to the positive benefits of living in urban areas (such as greater access to healthcare, improved educational opportunities, higher wages, etc.) \\], the time spent indoor will increase. Indeed, urban areas usually lack opportunities to have large amounts of contact with nature, compared to rural ones \\].
Therefore, since in the immediate future we are likely to continue spending more time in confined spaces, the role of the built environments in which we live has become of the utmost importance, as the pandemic has strongly highlighted \\]. A...[Content truncated]

website_quality_evaluation.justification: The National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI) provides access to a wealth of biomedical information and research articles. The accuracy and reliability of their data are exceedingly high.

Relevance.Relevance Justification: This evidence addresses the impact of indoor environments on well-being, which provides indirect context about the importance of architectural features. While it does touch on housing characteristics, it doesn't directly help in identifying the video's location, thus its relevance is moderate.

QA.Question: What specific architectural features in the video might help identify its actual location, apart from Epstein's island?
QA.Answer:
The viral video contains various architectural features that could aid in identifying its actual location, apart from any unfounded associations with Epstein's island. Here are some specific features to consider:

1. **Intricate Architectural Details**: The presence of large pillars and distinct floor patterns suggests a level of opulence typically found in luxury spaces. This could point to high-end residential interiors, spas, or hotels known for their detailed and elegant architectural styles. Such characteristics align with common traits of luxurious designs as highlighted by professional design firms which focus on creating high-quality interior settings [Query 2_evidence_1].

2. **Spa or Bathhouse Aesthetic**: The description of the indoor settings resembling a spa or bathhouse, with features indicative of relaxation and wellness, could link to specific cultural or luxury bathing traditions found globally. Notable examples include the historic sulfur baths in Tbilisi, Georgia, which were influenced by Persian architecture and share a cultural significance in their design [Query 1_evidence_1]. The presence of elements like checkered floors and decorative tiles could correlate with similar traditional or luxury bathing venues in various parts of the world.

3. **Interior Spaces and Decorative Details**: The video showcases different individuals and interactions involving various surfaces, which may reflect cultural practices or social environments in luxurious interior designs. Understanding these character-defining elements—including the shape of rooms, craftsmanship, and overall layout—could provide clues about the building type or its intended use, further distancing the location from any implications tied to Epstein [Query 2_evidence_2].

Based on the provided evidence and the logical reasoning process behind identifying these architectural features, I would evaluate my confidence in this conclusion as **85%**. This confidence level is attributed to the correlations made between observed features in the video and established characteristics of luxury interior design and cultural bathing practices. However, definitive identification of the location would require further substantiation from more specific historical or geographical sources.
